modules.description: This module manages text attributes in format strings, enabling dynamic control of rendering modes like color and style. It operates on string-based tags, allowing attributes to be shown, hidden, or globally toggled. Concrete use cases include selectively enabling colors in terminal output or conditionally applying formatting to tagged text regions.

This module processes tagged text in format strings using S-expressions to define tags and attributes, supporting modes like HTML, ANSI color, and block formatting. It works directly with OCaml's `Format.formatter`, enabling dynamic switching between rendering behaviors and handling attribute escaping, color sequences, and tag expansion. Concrete use cases include generating styled HTML output, conditionally enabling terminal colors, and embedding structured metadata in log messages.
